result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott G Zuniga was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
15 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.  $200 DNA surcharge assessed.
Deft is ordered to provide a DNA specimen.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Per RCSO, DNA collected - 10-12-2015 at 9:15 am

Defendant Scott G Zuniga in court with attorney Joshua Hargrove.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Plea - NC.
BTC: GUILTY.
Deft is ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
$600+cc+DNA, apply bond from case 15CM1219, pp $50/mo beg 12-1-15, ftp 15 days RCJ for contempt.
Pre-Trial Conference and Order/case adjourned off the record.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Scott G Zuniga in court with attorney Joshua Hargrove.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Status conference scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
